core.map.movingrule

Class MovingRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.map.movingrule.MovingRule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AllNeighborMovingRule, OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule, UncutNeighborMovingRule

    public abstract class MovingRule
extends java.lang.Object
    A MovingRule defines which movements on a grid are allowed an which not.

    A MovingRule also defines forced- and SubDirections considering the given movement rules.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Loka
    See Also:
    MovingRuleStrategy, AllNeighborMovingRule, UncutNeighborMovingRule, OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovingRule

        public MovingRule()

    • Method Detail

      • getAllDirections

        public java.util.Collection<Vector> getAllDirections()
        Returns all allowed movement directions.

        Default Implementation: Returns all orthogonal and diagonal directions in a 2-dimensional space.
        Returns:
        all orthogonal and diagonal directions in a 2-dimensional space.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

      • getForcedDirections

        public abstract java.util.Collection<Vector> getForcedDirections(MapFacade map,
                                                                 Vector currentPoint,
                                                                 Vector direction)
        Returns all forced directions based on passed obstacles.

        A valid implementation returns all forced directions considering the implementation specific definition of a forced point considering the accepted moving rules.
        Parameters:
        map - map to apply moving rules.
        currentPoint - A passable point on the map.
        direction - The direction vector in {-1,0,1}^2 in which the currentPoint was reached.
        Returns:
        A set of all directions d: currentPoint + d = forced point.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        AllNeighborMovingRule, UncutNeighborMovingRule, OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

      • getSubordinatedDirections

        public java.util.Collection<Vector> getSubordinatedDirections(Vector direction)
        Returns all subordinated directions of a prioritized input direction considering the accepted moving rules.

        Default Implementation (diagonal first): If the input is a basis vector, return an empty set. Else return a set of the basis vectors which add up to the input.
        Parameters:
        direction - a direction vector in {-1,0,1}^2
        Returns:
        A set of all subordinated directions based on the input direction.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

      • isCornerCut

        public boolean isCornerCut(MapFacade map,
                           Vector currentPoint,
                           Vector direction)
        Returns true, if a corner is cut without permission by moving in input direction by leaving currentPoint. Otherwise returns false.

        Default Implementation(Corner Cutting is allowed): Corner is independent of the input never cut.
        Parameters:
        map - map to apply moving rules.
        currentPoint - A passable point on the map.
        direction - The direction vector in {-1,0,1}^2 in which the currentPoint is leaving.
        Returns:
        false
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        UncutNeighborMovingRule
